attributes.action: The outcome of the EU referendum must be declared void.
attributes.additional_details:
There are numerous examples.
One of the most controversial claims of the campaign was that the UK sends £350m a week (or £50m a day) to Brussels, which could be spent on the NHS instead.  Many bodies including the UK Statistics Authority pointed out that we do not send that much a week because the rebate is deducted before any money is spent.  Source: BBC Reality Check website.
That BBC website is a good source of information about inaccurate claims from both sides of the referendum debate.
attributes.background: We now observe that during the recent EU referendum there was a deliberate and serious misrepresentation of factual information by holders of public office. This behaviour is inconsistent with the Nolan principles of objectivity, openness and honesty and is unacceptable.
